statement: Says Sen. Bernie Sanders lived off welfare before he was elected, never held a "9-5 job" and hasn’t proposed a single bill that passed.

Says Hillary Clinton's health care plan from the 1990s "had a broader provision in favor of corporate right to back out" of providing contraceptive coverage than the one created by the Hobby Lobby Supreme Court decision.
A Marine painted his house red, white and blue after he "was told by his neighbors that he could not fly the American flag in his yard all year long."
"Gross income tax receipts are exceeding the Administration’s projections for this fiscal year prior to Sandy."

"Tommy Thompson created the first school choice program in the nation, giving thousands of Milwaukee students the choice of where they go to school – no matter where they live or how much money their parents make."
"In some states, it is still legal to deny a woman coverage because she's been the victim of domestic violence."
Says Barack Obama didn't keep his promise to have an immigration bill in his first year.
"Subsidies for oil and gas companies make up 88 percent of all federal subsidies. Just cutting the oil and gas subsidies out would save the U.S. government $45 billion every year."
The state’s overall revenues only returned this year to 2007 levels.
Taxpayers pay $18,000 a month for House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's district office in downtown San Francisco.
The United States has "one of the highest corporate tax rates in the world."
The Buffett Rule "will bring in less than $5 billion per year. ... Enough to pay one week’s interest on the national debt."
Says Rep. Kyrsten Sinema supported a bill that is "essentially encouraging child trafficking."
Federal regulations required the changes to Georgia's driver’s license renewal process.
"The cost-of-living increase in Social Security is tied to wage inflation."
Says Paul Ryan's budget relies on the same $700 billion in savings from Medicare that Mitt Romney and other Republicans have been attacking Democrats about.
"There has been no net global warming for over a decade now."
Says many public-employee unions falsely told their Wisconsin members his budget-repair bill sought 12 percent to 13 percent of their incomes for health insurance premiums.
"Today, for the first time in fifteen years, Master Lock’s unionized plant in Milwaukee is running at full capacity."

"Jeff Greene only moved from California to Florida in the last two years. In fact, he would not legally be allowed to run for any other statewide office because he has not lived here long enough to meet the residency requirement."
"There are ‘sore loser’ laws that would bar Luther Strange from pursuing a seat" because he already lost the Alabama Republican Senate runoff to Roy Moore.
Says Andrew Gillum has a "far left socialist platform."
The highest paid employee of the State of Rhode Island is a basketball coach.
"Austin is number one in Texas in startups, venture capital and patents."
"You lie!" (in response to President Obama saying health reform would not insure illegal immigrants.)
Federal spending is "all discretionary, other than interest on the national debt. Social Security is discretionary. We have the discretion to change the law. Same is true with Medicare and Medicaid."
"Twenty-five states have lower unemployment than Texas" which is "tied with Mississippi for more minimum-wage jobs than anywhere in the United States."
Says "every time" the DSCC endorsed someone in North Carolina's U.S. Senate primary, "and the person they didn’t support was black, the candidate they picked ended up losing."
According to a recent poll, "there are more young Republicans enrolled in their parents' (health insurance) plans than young Democrats."
"The Obama administration just issued instructions that terrorism training should not involve any reference to Islam."
"I am the only candidate that has endorsed Bernie Sanders for President. In PA, I've got Bernie's back."
Democratic presidents "have been considerably more effective at creating private-sector jobs."
"ICE is required to fill 34,000 beds with detainees every single night and that number has only been increasing since 2009."
"There has never been a death caused by a [commercial nuclear] reactor in the United States, even when Three Mile Island failed in the 1970s."
Says Donald Trump said, "Do not be distracted by all this going on in Afghanistan. Always keep one eye on Washington D.C. A magician always distracts his audience."
"Marijuana is less addictive than both alcohol and tobacco."
"Italian Parliament Calls For The Arrest of Bill Gates"
Says Whoopi Goldberg kept her job and was applauded by ABC after calling Jeanine Pirro a racist slur.
"My opponent is endorsed by Citizens United."
The federal government "can cut all of the non-military discretionary spending and not balance the budget."
Says Rick Scott’s "hospital company stole millions, defrauding the military’s health care program."
"Since the week ending March 14, Wisconsin actually saw a drop in tourism spending compared to last year of $1.7 billion."
"We now have about one-third of New York’s population on Medicaid."
"No other country" is having a "second wave" of COVID-19 "because they are not trying to unseat a President in November."
Says budget savings by reducing pay and benefits for federal employees total $103 billion over 10 years -- more than $50,000 per worker.
"The US has made strides in reducing carbon emissions that other parts of the world have not."
Ron Howard wrote a Facebook post about being a liberal.

"In the mid 1990s, in our state, (Florida was) No. 1 in violent crime in America. ... The only concern I had was for the citizens of Florida, who were subjected to a violent crime every three minutes and 45 seconds."
"It was allowed," referring to her email practices.
"For now, we are still below average in the metro region."
"Almost 10 percent of Canadians came to visit Florida last year ... (Canadians) buy 7.4 percent of our homes in the state."
By 2009, "dozens of senior terrorists had been taken off the battlefield" by drones.
"The Railroad Commission of Texas has nothing to do with railroads."
Says Dan Forest has "missed almost half of the Board of Education meetings during the pandemic."
"The world food demand is going to double sometime between now and 2070."
"Florida school drops Common Core – soars to number one"
The Austin Independent School District’s graduation rate reached an all-time high of 82.5 percent in 2012.
Says President Barack Obama is trying to "pack" the D.C. Circuit Court of Appeals.
"Cantor's campaign spent more at steakhouses than Brat spent on his entire campaign."
Says a Washington Post headline and graphic about COVID-19 deaths are misleading.
"I’ve been against that war in Afghanistan from the very beginning."
Says "over 50 percent of U.S. job growth in June came" from Wisconsin.
State budget cuts for local schools resulted in "nearly 4,000 educator layoffs"
"The national economy was strong in its largest expansion of private sector jobs before President Trump came into office."

John D. Rockefeller coined the term "fossil fuel" to trick people into thinking that his product was scarce and drive up the price when fossil fuels are actually "the second most abundant liquid on the planet."
Tim Kaine wants to thwart "right-to-work reform measures in Midwest battleground states."
"Two years after the worst recession most of us have ever known ... corporate profits are up."
"All signs seem to point to Hillary (Clinton) laying the groundwork to run for president again."
"I was always labeled as one of the most liberal members of the United States Congress."
The "error rates" for the Fulton County elections department are "well below the average."
Speaking of immigration cases, says, "We have thousands of judges."
"In Chicago, they've had thousands of shootings, thousands since Jan. 1. Thousands of shootings."
"This administration and this Congress have been systematically cutting funding to border security since the Democrats took control."
"Geithner still didn't correct the same type of error for some years, even after the Internal Revenue Service flagged him for the failure to pay the taxes in other years."
Joe Biden gave his used face mask to Stephen Breyer.
"You know what the biggest lie is, is that restaurants are spreaders of COVID. There's no science for that."
As mayor of Newark, N.J., Cory Booker "stole $600,000 from a city water authority and laundered it through his law firm."
"Iowa ranks 45th in the U.S. for internet connectivity."
If masks prevent coronavirus, governors would have given them to prison inmates instead of releasing them.
"Puerto Rico mayor facing fraud charges over $3M in federal disaster relief"
Video shows "pupils in Nigeria running away from being vaccinated."
After the attack on a U.S. diplomatic mission in Benghazi, Libya, "the ambassador's body was dragged through the street."
"Our economy actually shrank during the last three months of 2012."
"In fiscal year 2011-2012, 4,191 abortions were paid for by taxpayers via the Oregon Health Plan."
"President Obama's proposed 'spending freeze' will only reduce the $42 trillion in government spending proposed between 2011 and 2020 by little more than one-half of 1 percent."
"I never once asked that (Megyn Kelly) be removed" as a debate moderator.
"A tax on soda and juice drinks would disproportionately increase taxes on low-income families in Philadelphia."
Says that in 2011, Oregon had "the second fastest growing economy in the nation."
"We adopted the modern Social Security system at a time when the average person died before they were old enough to get Social Security."
Says Nancy Pelosi’s son served on the Burisma board with Hunter Biden.
"Qataris don't really work."
"No one has been hospitalized for" the omicron variant of COVID-19.
Says President Franklin Delano Roosevelt sent his advisers to study socialism with Soviet dictator Josef Stalin so the president could replicate it in the United States.
The health care law includes tort reform.
"A majority of Americans agree with" a ban on assault weapons. "And by the way, so did Ronald Reagan."
"There are about 350,000 people who succeed in crossing our borders illegally each year."
Headlines show CNN published contradictory reports about hydroxychloroquine in 2020.
"As a former federal prosecutor, I prosecuted over 4,000 cases."
Says Joe Biden said, "This country is doomed, not just because of African Americans, but because by 2040 this country is going to be minority white European."
Says Allen West violated federal law by scuba diving with U.S. flag.
